page.title: 01LANDSCAPE AND ECOLOGY
page.content: Godshill Landscape and Ecology. This is a rural area, devoted to farming - crop, animal and market gardening. The soil is deep and fertile and the climate mild. The area is cut by four valleys running roughly North/South, cut by tributaries of the eastern River Yar,which flows into the Solent at Bembridge. These valleys are marshy and not suitable for ploughing and show up clearly in the pattern of fields. The picturesque village of Godshill in the south-west corner of the area was originally a small cluster of cottages around the foot of a hill on which stands the 14C Church.It is now a dormitory area, its own industry being tourism as is evident from the large car parks, tea gardens, gift shops and resort attractions.
